meanings.sent1: The old rug looked even grubbier after the dog ran through the mud.
meanings.sent2: The children's hands were grubbier than usual after playing in the sandbox.
meanings.sent3: Despite his efforts, the little boy always ended up grubbier than when he started.
meanings.sent4: The neglected garden appeared grubbier with each passing day, overrun with weeds.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house had a grubbier exterior than anyone in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of neglect or lack of cleanliness
meanings.sent1: The unkempt room looked even grubbier with clothes strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The neglected car appeared grubbier with each layer of dust accumulating on it.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, the house always ended up looking grubbier than she intended.
meanings.sent4: The grubbier appearance of the street indicated a lack of maintenance by the city.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned building had a grubbier facade than any other structure in the area.

meanings.definition: Having a shabby or unkempt appearance
meanings.sent1: The old, torn couch looked even grubbier with each passing year.
meanings.sent2: The shabby motel room appeared grubbier compared to the luxurious hotel suite.
meanings.sent3: Despite the cleaning efforts, the room always ended up looking grubbier than before.
meanings.sent4: The grubbier attire of the beggar stood out among the well-dressed crowd.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned warehouse had a grubbier exterior than any other building on the block.
